definition: to take along with one
band/belt/girdle/ribbon/tire/area/zone/region/CL:條|条[tiao2]/to wear/to carry/to take along/to bear (i.e. to have)/to lead/to bring/to look after/to raise

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: It makes sense that money can never be brought or taken, as always said.
sentences.chinese: 老生常谈的钱财生不带来死不带去是有道理的。

sentences.english: Because it's very easy to carry.
They have taken away Chinese nation's bright civilization for the country of residence.
sentences.chinese: 他们为侨居国带去了中华民族的灿烂文明。

sentences.english: Why did you not carry them away with your forks and spoons?
sentences.chinese: 您为什么没有把那对烛台和餐具一同带去呢？

sentences.english: Living not bring death, there is no reason to care too much.
sentences.chinese: 生不带来，死不带去，实在没有理由过分在意。

sentences.english: They had even taken the son of one tenant to the police station.
sentences.chinese: 他们甚至把一个住户的孩子带去了警察局。

sentences.english: Please take my humble alms food to him.
sentences.chinese: 请将这粗糙的食物带去给他。

sentences.english: Love this stuff, pving not bring, bring death.
sentences.chinese: 爱情这种东西，生不带来，死不带去的。

sentences.english: The ice cream, can always take away ice crisp cool enjoyment to the people.
sentences.chinese: 雪糕，总能给人们带去冰爽清凉的享受。

sentences.english: Mana Ina, on the other hand, was brought to Manila by his uncles.
sentences.chinese: 而曼娜艾娜，则被她舅舅带去了马尼拉。

sentences.english: The jester took the gold chain to Princess Lenore.
sentences.chinese: 小丑把金项链带去给丽诺儿公主。

sentences.english: He carries the picture in his wallet to this day.
sentences.chinese: 那天，他把放在钱包里的照片带去了。

sentences.english: The Bourbons carried away with them respect, but not regret.
sentences.chinese: 波旁家族带去了尊敬的心，却没有带走惋惜的心。

sentences.english: You can\\'t take your money and fame with you after you die.
sentences.chinese: 金钱和名誉都是生不带来死不带去的。

sentences.english: Every year we took more and more plays to court at Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 每年圣诞，我们都给宫廷带去更多的戏剧。

sentences.english: He alone moves poetry north of Boston.
sentences.chinese: 他一个人把诗歌带去了波士顿北部。

definition: to send to/to deliver to/to give sb a lift (e.g. in a car)

to bring back
to return sth to sb
to take along with one
to leave behind/to stay behind/to remain/to keep/not to let (sb) go

to give one's respects/to send a greeting/(fig.) (coll.) to make offensive reference to (somebody dear to the person to whom one is speaking)
gift/present/CL:件[jian4],個|个[ge4],份[fen4]
to offer to God
to set aside for
